intro: Hieracium patens subsp. eurypus, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from June to September. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
